w:Header.w:Heading: Bootstrap
w:Header.p: PWT is fully based on Twitter bootstrap Css framework. So it is fully responsive and fully themable.

w:HTMLPanel.w:Heading: Bootstrap Theming
w:HTMLPanel.p: Use the following button to change the documentation theme. You can note that those themes are free bootstrap theme downloaded from http://bootswatch.com/
w:HTMLPanel.w:Heading: Create a theme
w:HTMLPanel.p: To use your own theme or use an existing one. You just have to create a new Theme and add the CssLink, then you can apply it with the ThemeController.
When you install a theme the old one (if setted) is properly removed.

w:Alert.p:
PWT has some components not present in Bootstrap theme.
If you apply a particular Bootstrap theme, you need to customize the css for those componenents such as NavSpy, InputSlider.
You can find all customizations in the pwt-core.css file.
Plugins can also provide their own CSS file (pwt.css ).

w:HTMLPanel.w:Heading: Global component theming
w:HTMLPanel.p: You may want to theme a particular component specifically. Therefore we set on each component a specific CSS class which is the component simple class name prefixed by "p-" (to avoid collision with existing CSS class).
For instance the Container component has a p-container CSS class and the HTMLPanel component has a p-h-t-m-l-panel CSS class (the class name is in lower-hyphen case)

w:Alert.p: We never use those specific CSS classes to theme our components. It's fully dedicated to your usage.
